Not without acrobatics (If running single Heritrix instance: 
Heritrix.getSingleInstance().getJobHandler().getCurrentJob().getUID();).

I'd be interested to learn why you need it.

Problem (or feature), is that CrawlJob and CrawlController do not 
intersect in the data model (other than CrawlJob creates and sets a 
CrawlController running).  This has been sort of intentional though now 
its possible to have multiple instances of CC in the one JVM instance, 
we should probably at least give each CC an identifier (It might as well 
be the CJ UID).

Would CrawlController#toString() work as an identifier or does the 
identifier have to live past the life of a CrawlJob?

St.Ack




tizo_trico wrote:
>
> Hi there,
>
> Is there a way to obtain the UID (method getUID() of CrawlJob
> instance), from a processor and from the scope?
>
> If yes, how that can be done?
>
> If not, is there a way to obtain another unique identifier from those
> modules?
>
> Thanks very much,
>
> tizo
>
>
